org.springframework.cloud.aws.jdbc.datasource

Class TomcatJdbcDataSourceFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.tomcat.jdbc.pool.PoolProperties
      • org.springframework.cloud.aws.jdbc.datasource.TomcatJdbcDataSourceFactory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable, org.apache.tomcat.jdbc.pool.PoolConfiguration, DataSourceFactory

    public class TomcatJdbcDataSourceFactory
extends org.apache.tomcat.jdbc.pool.PoolProperties
implements DataSourceFactory
    A Tomcat JDBC Pool DataSourceFactory implementation that creates a JDBC pool backed datasource. Allows the configuration of all configuration properties except username, password, url and driver class name because they are passed in while actually creating the datasource. All other properties can be modified by calling the respective setter methods. This class uses a DatabasePlatformSupport implementation to actually retrieve the driver class name and url in order to create the datasource.

    All properties are derived from PoolConfiguration of the Tomcat JDBC Pool class.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Agim Emruli
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • createDataSource

        public org.apache.tomcat.jdbc.pool.DataSource createDataSource(DataSourceInformation dataSourceInformation)
        Description copied from interface: DataSourceFactory
        Creates a datasource with the passed in information. The datasource itself should be fully constructed and initialized to be used in a multi threaded environment.
        Specified by:
        createDataSource in interface DataSourceFactory
        Parameters:
        dataSourceInformation - - the DataSourceInformation parameter object which holds all dynamic information for the datasource creation.
        Returns:
        - a fully initialized datasource instance which can be used by the application to actually interact with a database platform

      • closeDataSource

        public void closeDataSource(DataSource dataSource)
        Description copied from interface: DataSourceFactory
        Will be called if the datasource is not used anymore to allow the factory to release any resource that are used by the created object. Implementation should check if the passed in datasource is a "known" datasource and if so interact with the to shutdown the datasource. On well known datasource like Apache Commons DBCP and Apache Tomcat JDBC this method will call the close() method to release any connection which are held in the pool.
        Specified by:
        closeDataSource in interface DataSourceFactory
        Parameters:
        dataSource - - The datasource that is not used anymore and can be destroyed by the factory
